instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had liquid damage. Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and all corroded components which achieved a fan spin. After ultrasonic cleaning everything works but I have no sound. I also have no chime when powering it up

have 4.25V on pin 24,25 of  <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and 4.25V on pin 1 of <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>

Not sure what to check next.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message:
4.25V on pin 1? That should be 3V3!

Voltage on pin 46, 9 and 3?

Audio device recognized in OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message:
pin 46  4.82V

pin 9 0v

pin 3 0v

internal speakers are recognized in OSX

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message:
Have you looked at the diagram and checked what pin 9 and 3 should be? What about pin 1? Are you measuring the correct pins, as all measurements seem weird to me. Chime will only come through the 4 pin case speaker, not the one on the board.

Can you adjust volume in OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message:
pin 9 1.42V pin 1 3.13V pin 3 1.42V pin 46 4.83V

All I have is schematic and cant find where it says what they are suppose to be but I measured a second time, yes measuring the correct pins.

yes can adjust volume in OSX

what to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: Then the audio chip is working so it is an analog problem. Does the headphone output work?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: Headphone output also does not work. What to try next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: headphone output also does not work. what to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: Was there any corrosion around <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>? <SIGNAL>CS4206_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: no corrosion around <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> and [LEFT][COLOR=#353535][FONT=Arial][SIZE=12px]<SIGNAL>CS4206_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> [/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]is present but only .5V and flucuating

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: If you are 100% sure the 4.5V is making it to the chip then at this point I would say the chip is dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: getting 5.12V on pin 46, just finished replacing chip but no change. What to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: Pin 24/25 carry the 4.5V  for the analog part of the chip. Is it still recognized under OSX and can change the volume after replacing it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message:
yes still recognized in osx and can adjust volume after replacing chip but still no sound.

Are you suggesting running a jumper from pin 24 to 25? Not sure what carry the 4.5V means.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: Yes have exactly 4.51v on pin 24 and 25

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: There is just not much more to this. Check pin 46 again and <SIGNAL>CS4206_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>HPAMP_REF</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message: I have 0V on <SIGNAL>CS4206_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL>  Replaced it but still 0V  and <SIGNAL>HPAMO_REF</SIGNAL> is 0.305V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sound problem
threads.message:
Checked on a known good and it is also 0V.

I am out of ideas on this one now. Last ditch is to diode mode all pins of <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and compare to a working board.
